Name: flg22
Notes: canonical flg22 sequence, triggers PTI in Arabidopsis. Derived from flagellin of various bacteria, including Pseudomonas aeruginosa
Abbreviation Key: Arabidopsis = Arabidopsis thaliana, a model plant from which our FLS2 sequence is derived

Name: X22
Notes: Triggers a slight response in Arabidopsis only at high concentrations of peptide. Derived from Xanthomonas campestris pv campestris strain B186

Name: E22
Notes: Triggers a response in Arabidopsis only at high concentrations of peptide. Derived from Erwinia amylovora strain CFBP 1430
Abbreviation Key: antagonist = flagellin peptide which binds FLS2 but doesn't trigger downstream immunity in planta

Name: R22
Notes: Does not trigger any response in Arabidopsis. Derived from Ralstonia solanacearum strain K60

Name: flg22_18AYA20
Notes: Mutation to residues 18-20 of flg22 that serves as an antagonist (binds but doesn't trigger downstream signaling)

Name: flg22_psy
Notes: Triggers a response in Arabidopsis. Derived from Pseudomonas syringae

Name: flg22_rso
Notes: Does not trigger a response in Arabidopsis. Acts as a weak antagonist. Derived from Ralstona solanacearum

Name: flg22_rso mutant
Notes: Does not trigger a response in Arabidopsis. Variant of [8]

Name: flg22_rso mutant
Notes: Triggers a response in Arabidopsis, though somewhat lower than [6]. Variant of [8]

Name: flg22_rso mutant
Notes: Triggers a response in Arabidopsis, though somewhat lower than [6]. Variant of [8]

Name: flg22_rso mutant
Notes: Triggers a response in Arabidopsis, though somewhat lower than [6]. Variant of [8]

Name: flg22_psy mutant
Notes: Does not trigger a response in Arabidopsis. Single mutant variant of [6]

Name: CLV3p
Notes: Unrelated peptide which does not trigger response in protoplast model.

Name: flg15
Notes: 100-fold decreased response compared to flg22

Name: flg22-Δ2
Notes: Does not trigger a response in Arabidopsis. Acts as an antagonist
